page.title: 01Boulmer and Environs
page.content: The area consists of a coastal strip with low-lying agricultural land behind to the west. The beach is shady but with some rocky outcrops and a natural harbour is formed at Boulmer Haven which is used by the dozen or so inshore fishing boats known as Cobles which are worked by men from the village of Boulmer. The village has about 100 inhabitants and is of linear shape running from north to south. With the exception of some private and local authority housing at the south end, the village and its buildings are owned by the Duke of Northumberland. The villagers are extremely friendly and life in the village is centred on the Boulmer Volunteer Rescue Service, the Fishing Boat Inn, a small church and the village hall. Inland, the main featrue is RAF Boulmer which services an air/sea rescue service,
